member.name: T:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IMediaFileUrl
member.summary: Encapsulates media file URL representation.

member.name: P:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IMediaFileUrl.RelativePath
member.summary: Relative path of the media file.
member.remarks:
Generates various path types depending on the media library location:
Path Location
~/getmedia/fileGUID/fileName.extension Media file is located in a media library on the current site.
http://domain.com/getmedia/fileGUID/fileName.extension Media file is located in a media library on a different site.

member.name: P:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IMediaFileUrl.DirectPath
member.summary: Direct path of the media file.
member.remarks:
Generates various path types depending on the media library location:
Path Location
~/mediaLibraryFolder/filename.extension Media file is located in a local media library on the current site.
http://domain.com/mediaLibraryFolder/filename.extension Media file is located in a local media library on a different site.
http://CDN/mediaLibraryFolder/filename.extension Media file is located in a media library stored in CDN.
~/getmedia/fileGUID/fileName.extension Media file is located in a media library which is located outside of the CMS application on the current site.
http://domain.com/getmedia/fileGUID/fileName.extension Media file is located in a media library which is located outside of the CMS application on a different site.

member.summary: Sets the expiration of the cached data.
member.param: Expiration time span.
Indicates if the sliding expiration should be used.
member.remarks: If the expiration is not configured the configuration of content cache minutes from site settings is used automatically. If multiple expiration provided the value of the last one configured is used.

member.name: M:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IPageCacheBuilder`1.Dependencies(System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0},Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IPageCacheDependencyBuilder{`0}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures the cache dependencies for the cached data.
member.param: Action to configure the cache dependencies.
Indicates if the system default cache dependencies should be used.
member.remarks: If the dependencies are not configured the automatic dependencies (on pages and page types) are configured based on retrieved data. If multiple dependency configuration actions provided the value of the last one is used to configure the dependencies.

member.name: T:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IPageRetriever
member.summary: Provides an interface for retrieving the pages based on given parameters together with a caching layer.

remarks.para: Reflects context of current site, culture and site settings for combining the culture with default culture. If the pages are retrieved within the preview, latest data is applied and unpublished pages are automatically included in the result. If the cache minutes are configured in the site settings, cache is applied to the retrieved data when at least cache key is provided.

member.name: M:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IPageRetriever.Retrieve``1(System.Action{CMS.DocumentEngine.DocumentQuery{``0}},System.Action{Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.IPageCacheBuilder{``0}})
member.summary: Retrieves pages based on given parameters.
member.typeparam: Type of the pages to be retrieved.
member.param: Action to apply the query parameters to limit the set of retrieved pages.
Action to build cache configuration in case the result should be cached.
member.remarks: Default parametrization is applied to reflect current site, culture and preview context. If cache is applied, current site name and culture code are included to the cache key automatically. If cache is applied, dependencies on pages included in the result as well as the page types are automatically configured.

member.summary: Route constraint to handle culture of the site.

member.name: P:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.SiteCultureConstraint.HideLanguagePrefixForDefaultCulture
member.summary: Indicates if the language prefix for default culture should be hidden.
member.remarks: Set this property to true if language prefixes are used for the URLs to identify the culture and the language prefix should be hidden for the URLs in default culture.

member.name: M:Kentico.Content.Web.Mvc.SiteCultureConstraint.Match(CMS.Base.Internal.IHttpContext,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether the URL parameter contains an allowed culture code for this constraint.
member.param: Object that encapsulates information about the HTTP request.
Name of the parameter that is being checked.
Object that contains the parameters for the URL.
Indicates whether the constraint check is being performed when an incoming request is being handled or when a URL is being generated.
member.returns: True if the URL parameter contains an allowed culture code; otherwise, false.
member.remarks:
When the culture code is empty the default value is retrieved based on these priorities: - Site domain alias visitor culture - Site default visitor culture - User preferred content culture - Browser culture - Default culture (from application settings).
The evaluated culture is used to set the current thread culture for localization to work correctly.

member.name: M:Kentico.Components.Web.Mvc.FormComponents.IGeneralSelectorDataProvider.GetItemsAsync(System.String,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Returns paged items that will be displayed in the general selector drop down list.
member.param: The search term entered in the user interface. Is empty when the user interface initializes.
The zero-based page index. The page size can be of any value but must be consistent across all requests.
The cancellation instruction.

member.name: M:Kentico.Components.Web.Mvc.FormComponents.IGeneralSelectorDataProvider.GetSelectedItems(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Kentico.Components.Web.Mvc.FormComponents.GeneralSelectorItem})
member.summary: Transforms the selected values collection into the selector items (value/text) collection.
member.param: The selected values to be displayed in the selector when it loads.
member.remarks:
This method is called only when the component properties dialog is opened and there are some items already selected in the selector.
This is a synchronous method since it is being used in ASP.NET MVC 5 which does not allow asynchronous child actions. The ASP.NET Core version of this interface requires an asynchronous method instead.

member.summary: Represents properties of the .

member.name: P:Kentico.Components.Web.Mvc.FormComponents.ObjectSelectorProperties.ObjectType
member.summary: Defines which objects will be displayed in the selector.
member.remarks: If the given object type declares a relation (either direct or via a binding entity) between an object of that type and a site then the current site's objects are only returned by default. To also include global objects in the result in addition to the site ones set to .

member.name: P:Kentico.Components.Web.Mvc.FormComponents.ObjectSelectorProperties.IdentifyObjectByGuid
member.summary:
Indicates whether the Object selector uses the object's GUID column value to identify the object. If set to the object's code name column value is used. Defaults to .
It's recommended to have it set to , ie. identify objects by their code names if a performance is a concern. The reason is that most system object types incorporate provider-level cache by the object's code name, not its GUID.

member.name: P:Kentico.Components.Web.Mvc.FormComponents.ObjectSelectorProperties.IncludeGlobalObjects
member.summary: Indicates whether global objects should be also returned in case when the may exist in both site and global form.
member.remarks: It has no impact on the result if doesn't denote direct site relationship.

member.name: P:Kentico.Components.Web.Mvc.FormComponents.ObjectSelectorProperties.WhereConditionProviderType
member.summary:
Defines the type which provides the that will be applied to the database query.
The where condition provider type must implement the interface.

member.summary: Defines a list of columns which the data should be sorted by, e.g. ["NodeLevel", "DocumentName DESC"]

member.name: T:Kentico.Forms.Web.Mvc.FormComponentStyleBundler
member.summary: Creates a style bundle for given bundle virtual path and list of source folders.
member.remarks: CMS.IO functionality is not supported, implementation uses System.IO deliberately.

member.name: M:Kentico.Forms.Web.Mvc.FormComponentStyleBundler.GetBundles(System.String,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})

summary.para: Returns style bundles for live site and administration UI.

Administration CSS files are expected to end with '.admin.css' suffix, any other '.css' files are considered live site styles. Both types of files must reside within '~/Content/FormComponents' or '~/Content/FormSections' directories or its subdirectories. Consider creating a subdirectory named by the corresponding form component's or section's identifier ('CompanyName.ModuleName.ComponentName', e.g. 'Kentico.Content.TextInputComponent').

member.param: Virtual path of the administration bundle.
Virtual path of the live site bundle.
Enumeration of source folders to include to the bundle.
member.remarks: The registered bundle also contains system specific CSS files, if any, residing in '~/Kentico/Content/FormComponents' or '~/Kentico/Content/FormSections'. No bundle is registered if neither the '~/Content/FormComponents' directory nor the '~/Kentico/Content/FormComponents' directory exist. The same applies to 'FormSections' directories.

member.summary: Renders necessary stylesheet link tags for using Form builder based forms on a live site. If no form component specific stylesheet is available, an empty string is returned.
member.param: HtmlHelper extension.
member.returns: Returns stylesheet link tags for form components, or an empty string.
member.remarks: Form components' additional stylesheets are expected to reside within the '~/Content/FormComponents' directory. member.summary: Virtual path for the live site style bundle.

member.name: M:Kentico.Forms.Web.Mvc.StylesBundleCollectionUtils.GetFormComponentsStyleBundles

summary.para: Returns style bundles for live site and administration UI.

Administration CSS files are expected to end with '.admin.css' suffix, any other '.css' files are considered live site styles. Both types of files must reside within '~/Content/FormComponents' or '~/Content/FormSections' directories or its subdirectories. Consider creating a subdirectory named by the corresponding form component's or section's identifier ('CompanyName.ModuleName.ComponentName', e.g. 'Kentico.Content.TextInputComponent').

member.remarks: The registered bundle also contains system specific CSS files, if any, residing in '~/Kentico/Content/FormComponents' or '~/Kentico/Content/FormSections'. No bundle is registered if neither the '~/Content/FormComponents' directory nor the '~/Kentico/Content/FormComponents' directory exist. The same applies to 'FormSections' directories.

member.remarks: Make sure to provide a unique identifier for the form component validation rule from the start. member.name: T:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.IPageBuilderRenderingContext
member.summary: Defines a contract for storage to store data necessary to render components.
member.remarks: The context is used when rendering the Page builder for the live site. Or when rendering a component programmatically e.g. either as stand-alone widget or nested widget. member.summary: Registers a page template definition to be used within the system.

member.name: M:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.PageTemplates.RegisterPageTemplateAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a page builder page template with a custom controller.
member.param: Unique identifier of the page template definition.
Type of the page template controller to register.
Name of the registered page template.
member.remarks: Make sure to provide unique identifier for the page template definition from the start. This identifier is used within the page configuration and any further change can lead to incorrect configuration load. Consider specifying identifier in format 'CompanyName_ModuleName_PageTemplateName', e.g. 'Kentico_Content_LandingPageTemplate'.

member.name: M:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.PageTemplates.RegisterPageTemplateAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a simple page builder page template using a view.
member.param: Unique identifier of the page template definition.
Name of the registered page template.
Type of the registered page template properties model. The type needs to implement the interface.
Custom view name for the registered page template. If not specified, the default system view name in format '~/Shared/PageTemplates/_{identifier}' is used.
member.remarks:
Make sure to provide unique identifier for the page template definition from the start. This identifier is used within the page configuration and any further change can lead to incorrect configuration load. Consider specifying identifier in format 'CompanyName_ModuleName_PageTemplateName', e.g. 'Kentico_Content_LandingPageTemplate'.
Use this attribute when simple page template is being developed and no custom controller is needed.

member.name: M:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.StylesBundleCollectionUtils.RegisterPageComponentsAdminStyleBundle(System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection)

summary.para: Registers styles bundle for administration UI to .

Styles must reside within '~/Content/InlineEditors' or '~/Content/Widgets' or '~/Content/Sections' directories or theirs subdirectories. Consider creating a subdirectory named by the corresponding identifier ('CompanyName.ModuleName.InlineEditorName', e.g. 'Kentico.Content.TextEditor').

member.param: Bundle collection to register the bundles into.
member.remarks: The registered bundle also contains system specific script files, if any, residing in '~/Kentico/Content/InlineEditors' or '~/Kentico/Content/Widgets' or '~/Kentico/Content/Sections. No bundle is registered if any of mentioned directories doesn't exist or doesn't contain any *.css files.

member.name: M:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.StylesBundleCollectionUtils.RegisterPageComponentsStyleBundle(System.Web.Optimization.BundleCollection)

summary.para: Registers styles bundle for live site to .

Styles must reside within '~/Content/Widgets' or '~/Content/Sections' directories or theirs subdirectories. Consider creating a subdirectory named by the corresponding identifier ('CompanyName.ModuleName.InlineEditorName', e.g. 'Kentico.Content.TextEditor').

member.param: Bundle collection to register the bundles into.
member.remarks: The registered bundle also contains system specific script files, if any, residing in '~/Kentico/Content/Widgets' or '~/Kentico/Content/Sections. No bundle is registered if any of mentioned directories do not exist.

member.name: T:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.RegisterWidgetAttribute
member.summary: Registers a widget definition to be used within Page builder feature.

member.name: M:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.RegisterWidgetAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a page builder widget with a custom controller.
member.param: Unique identifier of the widget definition.
Type of the widget controller to register.
Name of the registered widget.
member.remarks: Make sure to provide unique identifier for the widget definition from the start. This identifier is used within the page configuration of widgets and any further change can lead to incorrect configuration load. Consider specifying identifier in format 'CompanyName_ModuleName_WidgetName', e.g. 'Kentico_Content_ArticlesListWidget'.

member.name: M:Kentico.PageBuilder.Web.Mvc.RegisterWidgetAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Registers a simple page builder widget using a view.
member.param: Unique identifier of the widget definition.
Name of the registered widget.
Type of the registered widget properties model. The type needs to implement the interface.
Custom view name for the registered widget. If not specified, the default system view name in format '~/Shared/Widgets/_{identifier}' is used.
member.remarks:
Make sure to provide unique identifier for the widget definition from the start. This identifier is used within the page configuration of widgets and any further change can lead to incorrect configuration load. Consider specifying identifier in format 'CompanyName_ModuleName_WidgetName', e.g. 'Kentico_Content_ArticlesListWidget'.
Use this attribute when simple widget is being developed and no custom controller is needed.
